title: Analysis of University Lecture Types and Modern Teaching Methods: Microlearning for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of foundational educational theories and lecture design
context.additional_context: Non-face-to-face education in a BYOD environment, focusing on curriculum design emphasizing language and pedagogical methodologies

learning_goals: Learners will be able to distinguish between the six core types of university lectures: traditional, hybrid, flipped, online, interactive, and blended.
Learners will critically evaluate case studies on lecture effectiveness using Braun and Clarke’s thematic analysis method.
Learners will design mobile-based microlearning modules (5-minute duration) and apply them to specific language education objectives.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
